drupalNodeEvent.title: The Cornucopian Stage: Dramas of Endless Surplus in Early Modern China

field_speakers.processed: Ariel Fox, Assistant Professor of Chinese Literature, Department of East Asian Languages and Civilizations, University of Chicago

field_organizers.processed: Lieberthal-Rogel Center for Chinese Studies, University of Michigan

field_description.processed: The Cornucopian Stage: Dramas of Endless Surplus in Early Modern China ~ This talk takes the titular object of the play Jubaopen 聚寶盆 (Cornucopia), attributed to the Suzhou playwright Zhu Suchen 朱素臣 (ca. 1620–after 1701), as the point of departure for an exploration of the productive possibilities of early modern drama.
